title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: tresham college merges with bedford college .
'very rare ' problem closes a6 between rothwell and desborough until march .

documents.title: that 's it from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .

if you 're a rugby fan then there is full coverage of northampton saints against scarlets in the anglo-welsh cup on bbc radio northampton , and bbc tv has full coverage of the six nations , featuring six saints players across three nations .
have a good weekend .
we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 .

documents.title: local paper round-up : rushden lakes plans , second screen for cinema and dog poo paint
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pause for thought : finedon 's rev richard coles recalls his relationship with cricket
text: this morning on chris evans ' breakfast show , finedon vicar richard coles recalled his cricketing days and how the northamptonshire village has a fine tradition in the sport
author: BBC Radio 2

documents.title: college merger creates 'one of the most exciting colleges in uk '
text: bedford college will merge with tresham college this summer , and according to bedford 's principal and chief executive , ian pryce , it will create `` one of the most exciting colleges in the uk '' .
he added once `` due diligence and consultation has been completed '' , all staff , assets and liabilities will transfer to bedford college corporation .
the college states that `` students and staff at the colleges will continue as usual , and current courses will not be affected '' .

documents.title: problem engine piece found in wansford lorry fire
text: cause of hgv fire wansford , piston found , engine catastrophic failure .
ouch !
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five men charged over cannabis factory in crick
text: yesterday we brought you news of the police arresting five men at an `` industrial scale '' cannabis factory in crick .
all 10 rooms were being used to cultivate the drug and today those five men have been charged with drug and fraud offences .
the men , aged between 19 and 28 , have been remanded in custody and will appear at northampton magistrates ' court on 3 march , police say .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: great rolls of fire
text: the sliproad that connects the a1 to the a47 at wansford is currently closed due to a lorry blaze .
police say the lorry caught fire due to a mechanical failure as it came off the a1 at the wansford junction , and then jack-knifed .
the whole vehicle , including its contents of till roll , went up in flames .
the driver was uninjured .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: all tresham campuses to remain open and 'no job losses anticipated '
text: the principal at tresham college says he does not anticipate any job losses following the merger with bedford college .
he said there will be `` no changes at all '' to their current campuses in kettering , corby and silverstone .
ioan morgan said it is unlikely the students will notice any difference , and once the merger has completed the college will be `` looking to expand '' .
however , mr morgan said it would take a `` good close look '' at what the college would do in wellingborough .
the campus there is being demolished , with a £ 12.4m replacement shelved because of financial issues .
mr morgan said wellingborough `` needs some provision '' of further education , but `` maybe not as much as previously there '' .
he said it would discuss the situation with bedford college .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : england 's stellar 2016 grand slam
text: as if to prove john inverdale 's point , here 's how england , led by dylan hartley , completed the grand slam in the 2016 tournament
follow the six nations across the bbc .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: six nations : dylan hartley is eddie jones ' 'right-hand man ' - inverdale
text: rugby presenter john inverdale has described dylan hartley as an `` exceptional leader of men '' .

this time last year he told bbc radio northampton the northampton hooker 's appointment as england captain was `` inspired '' , and a year on it seems he was proved right - with england unbeaten last year .

inverdale told bbc radio northampton today that england coach eddie jones was `` desperate '' to have hartley available for the six nations , following his ban for striking an opponent with an arm , saying jones sees the 30-year-old as his `` right-hand man '' .
he will once again be fronting the bbc 's tv coverage of the six nations , which start tomorrow .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'rugby is a great sport for women ' # getinspired
text: it 's not only the men 's six nations that kicks off this weekend .
the women 's equivalent gets under way , too , with scotland hosting ireland this evening , followed tomorrow by wales v italy and - arguably the of the ties - england v france at twickenham .

the women 's game is really taking off across the uk , so watch england full-back danielle waterman explain her love of rugby and the different versions you can play - and if you 're inspired to up the oval ball yourself , check out our get inspired guide .
england women v france women kicks off at 19:35 gmt on saturday , with live coverage on bbc radio 5 live sports extra , plus highlights of all three matches on bbc two at 22:45 gmt .

documents.title: bedford and tresham college merger for 'financial security '
text: earlier we mentioned two colleges in northamptonshire and bedfordshire were joining forces .
once the merger between tresham and bedford college is complete , tresham will dissolve and its staff , assets and liabilities will transfer to bedford college .
bedford college principal and chief executive , ian pryce , said : `` the combined college will have the size and scale to ensure strong support services and financial security . ''
it 's hoped the larger college will raise standards at tresham .
students and staff will continue as normal and current courses wo n't be affected .
the new merged college will have an income of £ 60m and a total number of 15,000 students .
the demolition of tresham college 's campus at wellingborough has begun , but it will no longer be building a replacement due to financial issues , with courses switched to corby .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a bright start , but turning wet and windy later
text: rain will begin to push in during the afternoon , with some heavy bursts likely at times .
it will become increasingly windy too , especially in exposed areas .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: aidy boothroyd appointed england u21 boss
text: former watford and northampton town boss aidy boothroyd has been confirmed as manager of the england under-21 team .
the under-20 boss replaces gareth southgate , who vacated the role to become england manager after the departure of sam allardyce .
boothroyd , 45 , took charge for the u21 side 's final two euro 2017 qualifiers and secured qualification for this summer 's finals in poland .
`` i 've been at the fa three years ; this is the logical next step , '' he said .
boothroyd was in charge of watford for three seasons from 2005 , initially saving the club from relegation to the third tier before leading them to the top flight in 2006 .
the vicarage road side finished bottom of the premier league the following season .
he later took charge of northampton town in november 2011 with the side bottom of league two .
boothroyd guided them to safety , and the play-offs the next season , before being sacked in 2013 with the club once again last in the fourth tier .
after his sacking from the cobblers he joined the fa 's coaching staff .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: background to st luke 's construction
text: here 's a bit of background to the hospital saga
in 2007 a scheme to replace st luke 's with a new £ 30m hospital collapsed through a lack of money .
then in 2012 a hospital extension opened - albeit 18 months behind schedule .
then in 2014 it was announced the nhs was going to fund a £ 6.8m redevelopment - this was delayed for well over a year when construction eventually started in november 2015 .
finally in 2017 the new hospital building is complete .
phew
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tresham college merges with bedford college
text: tresham college , which has campuses at kettering , corby and silverstone in northamptonshire , is to merge with bedford college .

as reported in the northamptonshire telegraph , ofsted inspectors have been critical of standards at tresham and the further education commissioner has been involved with directing the work of the college .
the colleges aim to complete the merger by september .
we 'll bring you more on this story soon .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: decades of delays in hospital improvement
text: if you 're from the market harborough area you 'll know this new hospital building has been a long time coming .
new wards on the hospital site have been discussed since the 1980s .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nhs services to move to new building
text: construction of the three-storey st luke 's treatment centre began in november 2015
services currently provided at market harborough district hospital will be moved to the new building .
if you 're wondering where it is , it 's next to the old st luke 's hospital building on leicester road .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: st luke 's 'flagship ' facility complete
text: construction of the st luke 's treatment centre in market harborough is now complete .
does n't it look nice ?
the nhs is calling the new £ 7.5m building a `` flagship healthcare facility '' and say they are preparing to welcome the first patients in march .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cobblers bring back fitness coach from wilder regime
text: northampton town boss justin edinburgh has appointed pablo garcia as the club 's new fitness coach .
garcia was previously at the club under chris wilder and was part his backroom staff when the cobblers won league two last season .
edinburgh told the club 's website : `` pablo has been operating in the role for a couple of weeks and i have been impressed with his work .
`` i know he played an important role at the club last season .
he has the respect of the players and i am pleased to bring him back to the club . ''
edinburgh took over last month after chris wilder 's successor rob page was sacked following a string of defeats .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: road closures 'not about the structure of the highways ' , says councillor
text: jim hakewill , a kettering borough and county councillor , says the fact that two major a-roads are closed for repairs is not a sign the county 's highways are in a poor state .
part of the a6 around desborough and rothwell is closed until 28 february , and the a5199 near spratton is shut until 5 march .
conservative mr hakewill said the a6 issue was `` unusual '' and the repairs on the a5199 are due to a car hitting the spratton sands bridge .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic through spratton 'pretty constant ' because of a5199 closure
text: as well as the closure of the a6 , people in spratton say the closure of the a5199 means drivers are using the village as a cut-through to brixworth .
the main road is closed been spratton and chapel brampton until 5 march while a bridge is repaired .
the official diversion is up to the a14 and then back on the a508 , but many are using local roads as a shortcut .
at rush hour it 's pretty constant .
if you 're heading out from here you need to add 15 minutes on to your journey . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'very rare ' problem closes a6 between rothwell and desborough until march
text: the a6 around rothwell and desborough will remain closed until march while repair work continues to a bridge over the river ise .
a routine inspection uncovered `` significant voids '' under the tarmac on approaches to the bridge .
leon jolly , from northamptonshire highways , said engineers were working `` night and day '' to fix the problem .
however , he said it was a `` very rare event '' , which he had n't seen before in his 25 years as a road engineer .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: today 's weather : a bright start but windy
text: today is due to be very blustery - but mostly dry - during daylight hours although some cloud will push in from the west this afternoon bringing light patchy rain and drizzle in some places .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
the met office has issued a yellow warning of wind as gales are expected on friday and into saturday morning with inland locations likely to see a relatively short period of 40-50 mph gusts .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: we are here with live updates for northamptonshire .
today we 'll be takeing a look at the road closures which are affecting the county .

plus we 'll be building up to a busy weekend of sport , with northampton town heading to walsall and northampton saints taking on the scarlets in the anglo-welsh cup plus the start of the six nations .
but first up the windy weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: child sex and rape among 103 charges
text: child sex and rape among 103 charges

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
you can read more about the new police jobs announced today on our website .
meanwhile , if you want find out more about the saints players gearing up for the six nations head to the bbc sport website .
any breaking news will appear here through the evening and tonight .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
see you then .

documents.title: weather : cooler tonight , mixed tomorrow
text: apart from the odd shower it will be a mostly dry night with clear spells developing .
a cooler night than last night as winds ease , with lows of 5-7c ( 41-45f ) .
a cooler start tomorrow with some early sunshine .
turning cloudy later , with patchy rain spreading in by the afternoon .
the rain will be accompanied by freshening winds , with gusts of 40-50mph possible overnight .
highs tomorrow of 10c ( 50f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: arrests after cannabis factory raid
text: arrests after cannabis factory raid

documents.title: six nations : picamoles in france team to face england
text: northampton saints ' number eight louis picamoles will face off against his saints team-mates as he takes his place in the france side to face england on saturday .
picamoles , 30 , will be up against dylan hartley , courtney lawes and his club captain tom wood .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trial begins of northampton couple accused of sexually abusing 11 children
text: the trial of a northampton couple charged with 103 offences , including rape and abuse against children , has begun at leicester crown court .
nicholas taylor , 47 , and joan taylor , 43 , from briar hill , are accused of abusing 11 children , both male and female , as well as supplying class a drugs .
the prosecution said the alleged crimes began in 1996 until 2006 and occurred mostly at the taylor 's house on pitstone road .
nicholas taylor controlled the alleged sexual offending and his behaviour was `` bullying '' , `` manipulative '' and `` dangerous '' , the court was told .
the jury also heard the children were given crack cocaine before being allegedly abused .
the couple deny the charges and the case is expected to last seven weeks .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: 'industrial scale ' cannabis factory found in village
text: police have uncovered a massive cannabis factory in the village of crick .
officers say all 10 rooms of the house on church street were being used to grow the plants `` on an industrial scale '' .
police are in the process of removing hundreds of mature plants and equipment and have arrested five men .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : quirky and peculiar customs
text: thanks to vic foster for explaining the hare pie scramble to me after seeing this
`` the hare pie is what is served up at the beginning of hallaton bottle kicking , held every easter monday i think since about the beginning of time .
this is the annual contest between the people of hallaton and medbourne as they attempt to get a bottle ( called a cheese ) into their opponent 's home area .
the first to get two cheeses/bottles is the winner . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: apethorpe palace up for award for restoration work
text: the grade i-listed apethorpe palace , formerly known as apethorpe hall , is up for an award for its restoration work .
the current archaeology awards , run by the magazine of the same name , have nominated the work on the jacobean building in the east of the county , carried out by english heritage .
frenchman jean christophe baron pfetten bought apethorpe palace in 2014 for £ 2.5m .
english heritage had spent £ 8m on preserving the building after a previous owner left it in a poor state of repair .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up : town centre business row , reward offer over arson , rushden and diamonds move vote
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : further rain and strong winds
text: this afternoon there will be outbreaks of rain and it 'll be often cloudy , though some brighter periods are likely .
while it will be relatively mild , it may not feel it in the wind with a high of 10c ( 50f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : quirky and peculiar customs
text: a nice video about some slightly odd customs performed across the uk in the 1970s - including one in leicestershire
hare pie scramble can someone please explain ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police and fire looking for 'closer collaboration ' , says pcc
text: stephen mold , the police and crime commissioner for northamptonshire , continued he would be putting forward a `` business case of closer collaboration '' between the police and fire service to the home office and local councils .
the county has been praised by the government for its closer working between the emergency services , including the use of joint response vehicles .
mr mold said the fire service had done a `` great job protecting communities '' and the police service could `` look at prevention and learn from that '' .
he said he would be looking at working closer together in the use of technology and in crime and emergency prevention .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foden moves to the wing and leads saints for anglo-welsh cup game against scarlets
text: with tom wood starting for england at the weekend , ben foden takes over the captaincy for northampton saints but also moves to the wing , with george north away with wales and jamie elliot injured .
saints also bring academy product lewis ludlam in back row for tomorrow 's match against the scarlets .
your saints are
available from £ 19 at
go get 'em boys .
# uptheend # comeonyoujimmies
good looking team .
excited to get my birthday weekend off to a flyer under # fridaynightlights
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: no 'jump in numbers ' of police officers by new recruitment
text: earlier we mentioned northamptonshire police was creating 46 new jobs , with a number aimed at tackling cyber crime .
northamptonshire 's police and crime commissioner , stephen mold , said the roles were needed because `` the complexity [ of crime ] is growing '' .
he said cyber crime , safeguarding of children and historical sexual abuse cases `` required significant investment '' .
of the 46 new roles , 30 will be police officers .
mr mold said it is also ring-fencing community policing , meaning there will be no drop in the numbers of bobbies-on-the-beat .
although he did not rule out further recruitment , he warned : `` the force can not return to the days of every village having an officer .
it 's just not realistic because of the challenges the force faces . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hold on to your hats , it 's going to be windy tomorrow
text: a yellow warning of wind has been issued from 11:00 on friday , to 03:00 on saturday .

the met office says the likely scenario is for inland locations to see a relatively short period of 40-50mph ( 64-80km/h ) gusts , and coastal areas to see longer periods of 50-60mph ( 80-97km/h ) gusts .
yellow warning of wind for east of england

documents.title: six nations : north starts for wales in opener against italy
text: northampton saints ' wing george north has been selected in the wales side to face italy in rome on sunday .
north , 24 , made his comeback from his latest head injury last month .
wales face italy at the stadio olim on sunday at 14:00 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: six nations : hartley captains england , lawes and wood also start
text: northampton saints ' hooker dylan hartley has been for england 's six nations opener against france on sunday , captaining the side .
hartley , who led england to the grand slam last year , has n't played in six weeks after being banned for hitting leinster 's sean o'brien .
alongside hartley will be saints team-mates courtney lawes , who starts in the second row , and tom wood , who is in the back row .
fellow saints back row , teimana harrison , is on the bench for the match at twickenham on saturday , at 16:50 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: saints to sign eadie and ford-robinson
text: saints to sign eadie and ford-robinson

documents.title: cyber crime focus in police recruitment
text: a £ 2m investment will create 46 new `` front-line roles '' at northamptonshire police .

the county 's police and crime commissioner , stephen mold , said the jobs would specifically tackle cyber crime and in-part carry out early intervention work in areas such as child sexual exploitation and domestic violence .
it 's expected 30 of the roles will be full police officers .
the extra jobs are being partly funded by cuts in the commissioner 's office and a rise in the part of council tax that pays for policing .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: weather : further rain and strong winds expected at times
text: there are more details on the bbc weather website .
weather : mild and damp with stronger winds .
top temp 11c , @ twitterid has thursday 's forecast :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: brexit bill : 'great day ' , 'momentous ' and 'a privilege ' , say county 's mps
text: mps voted last night to allow the pm to begin the brexit process .
mps backed the european union bill by 498 votes to 114 , with 47 labour rebels voting against .
all of northamptonshire 's mps , all conservative , voted in favour of the bill , and some took to twitter to give their reaction
498 ayes for triggering article 50 ; 114 noes .
a momentous day
yes , this is the day the u.k. died
how 's that then ?
well scotland is going to leave the u.k. to preserve eu membership , and probably northern irelandso no uk
scotland needs europe though does n't it ?
so does n. ireland , they 'll still be neighbours , it may even help !
yes , they will leave to preserve eu membership , leaving behind ( some of ) england and maybe wales
do we not send millions to scotland ?
if they stay eu we can cut that and give it to wales possibly ?
they wo n't move the billions that 's generated/spent there on trident atm
money is n't generated by trident , its a huge boondoggle that scotland wants no part of .
and let us see what the scots will do now
i think nicola sturgeon has run out of options .
does n't look as though she 'd win a 2nd indyref .
either .
well alex salmond believes the scots can function due to their entrepreneurial skills .
who am i to disagree !
- a momentous day for your hard brexit with no plan ?
no access to european labour = no business , no food , no jobs
yes , the uk 's youth wo n't forget .
and will prosper because of it .
yes , momentous making thousands of british citizens abroad worry about their uncertain future .
# brexit
thats fully down to # eu .
pm may has said this should be agreed now , eu want it part of the negotiations # wrong
`` fully '' down to the eu ?
if the uk was n't leaving it would n't be a problem at all .
but we were n't allowed a vote ! !
why momentousness ?
thank you andrea you played a key part in moulding the great future that lies ahead now let 's make britain great together
a historic night in the @ twitterid voting to trigger # article50 and respecting the will of the people .
a privilege to be a part of it .
- indeed & history will show you were on the wrong side of it .
go !
tom , you played a notable ( historic ) part in it all .
does this mean you voted with the govt to trigger art 50 ?
just voted for the uk to leave eu !
great day for parliament !
did n't expect anything less from you .
thank you !
thank you , peter .
ty
thank you
i though we ( the people you represent ) all did that ages ago .
was n't up to you lot !
at last , some of us have been waiting since the first referendum 40 years ago tied us to the eussr 4th reich
probably need to vote again sometime .
and generations to come will up the pieces of the mess you created by having no real plan
such a shame to jump from the field of fiscal opportunity in such a catastrophic way i 'm not surprised .
@ twitterid thanks for all your hard work : )
@ twitterid oh & bgger a sizeable percentage of your voters.what you think is all that matters , for now !
i must say i was beginning to think it would never happen .
your tenacity paying off , well done .
we have waited 44 years for this .
if they want a 2nd ref .
let them wait 44 years
thank you for your steadfast campaign to win the argument to leave .
we appreciate your efforts
thanks for listening !
eu wants to ban potential us ambassador to eu lol
well done peter but once we take control of our country there should be a vote to bring back hanging for people who carry out terriost atack
nice one !
we chatted about this over email 18 months ago and pleased to say it 's finally starting !
good man mr bone .
a true brit in every sense .
i trust mrs bone is well ?
proud to be one of 498 mps who , this evening , voted in favour of triggering article 50 to begin the process of leaving the eu # brexitbill
i commend the 498 mps who realised this vote was about respecting a democratic decision and nothing to do with the eu .
well done
on one hand my faith in mps is restored knowing majority of house supported remain .
nevertheless 115 mps voted against democracy
no they did n't .
they voted agains triggering art50 before being presented with a well thought out plan .
the 498 mps should hang their heads in shame .
not one of your best , @ twitterid
embarrassed to have you as my mp
by proud do you mean suck arse ?
brexit , nothing to be proud of ,
absolutely awful decision the people have basically voted to be poorer
the correct result .
well done .
trying to see the good of brexit - success = happy days ; failure = tories out for a generation .
think i 'd prefer the latter
well done sir those trying to block brexit can no longer whine on about lack of parliamentary democracy
thank you !
- well done chris , thank you .

documents.title: northampton leading the way for business start-ups
text: northampton was second only to london in the number of new businesses that started during 2015 , according to the latest report from the centre for cities .
it says in the 12 month period , 100 businesses started in the town .

while the number does n't consider how many gained a foothold in the market , tim hadland , cabinet member for regeneration , enterprise and planning at northampton borough council , said : `` this year 's report confirms what we already suspected - that northampton continues to nurture , support and encourage enterprise . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire .
we 'll have more from the brexit vote in parliament yesterday and news of new front-line police officers for the county 's force .
plus later today we 'll find out which saints players have made the england team to face france in their six nations opener on saturday .
will captain dylan hartley , who has n't played in six weeks because of ban for striking with an arm , be in the side ?
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thanks for reading
text: that 's it from northampton 's local live page for today .
thanks for reading !
have a good evening .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : a cloudy and mild night
text: you may , if you were lucky , have caught a bit of brightness this afternoon , as the cloud thinned for a time .
it 's back to business as usual tonight though , as the cloud thickens through the evening .
it 'll be a mild night , though , thanks to the cloud , so temperatures could well be in double figures by dawn tomorrow .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: brexit debate a proud moment for wellingborough mp
text: wellingborough 's veteran brexiteer mp peter bone says the debate over article 50 is the culmination of six years of hard work , since he first tabled a motion for an eu referendum in 2011 .
following his speech at the debate at parliament , he spoke to bbc radio northampton 's drive programme .
`` did i think i 'd see the day when the house of commons would be about to vote to leave the eu ?
probably not .
i 'm amazed it 's happened , '' he said .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: iraqi colleagues 'bruised ' by trump 's travel ban
text: prof nick petford , the vice-chancellor of the university of northampton , says the ban on iraqis travelling to the usa will `` really annoy '' his colleagues at the university of babylon in iraq , which northampton partners with .
`` i think some of my iraqi colleagues are feeling particularly bruised , '' he said .
`` i think it 's an incredibly clumsy way to go about addressing a genuine issue , which is fundamentalist islamic terrorism . ''
`` no-one wants to support it - for the iraqi people it 's a disaster .
`` if you look around the world at who 's dying in these atrocities , it 's mostly muslims .
to put a blanket ban in wo n't be received well and is a propaganda victory for the terrorists . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: arson attack and poppy appeal in the local papers
text: arson attack and poppy appeal in the local papers
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: family prepare to seek cancer treatment ouside the uk
text: the wife of a 44-year-old market harborough father-of-two with cancer is campaigning to raise £ 10,000 to send him for special treatment abroad .
author: Harborough Mail

documents.title: illegal trade in dogs continues
text: the trade in illegally-imported dogs is continuing to thrive , despite increased efforts to tackle it .
according to dogs ' trust , 400 illegal puppies were detected in the past 12 months at cross channel ports - that 's a 10-fold increase on the year before .
the trust says that checks at ports `` are not fit for purpose '' .
it is n't just illegally imported dogs , though .
dogs up off the streets and imported legitimately can also bring difficulties , as valerie blades , a volunteer with dog rehoming charity wellidogs , told me .
`` [ in eastern europe ] dogs wander the streets , so when they 're up and re-homed over here quite often you ca n't train that out of them . ''
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: the heartbreaking cost of the trade in smuggled dogs
text: buying a puppy can be a fantastic experience , but as i heard on breakfast this morning , innocent buyers in our county are having their hearts broken by the illegal trade in dogs .
according to dogs ' trust , 400 illegal puppies were detected in the past 12 months at cross channel ports .
sam diamond , from northamptonshire trading standards , told me she thinks the issue is significantly under-reported .
`` since june 2013 we 've dealt with 16 cases of smuggled dogs , '' she said .
`` to me that 's quite a significant number and i agree with others that it 's the tip of the iceberg . ''
ms diamond told me of owners taking their new puppies to a vet , only to find `` eastern european microchips in them '' .
the dogs are quarantined , and the owner only gets them back if they pay the costs .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: another grey one !
text: it takes a special sort of photo to look good in weather this grey , but we think bbc weather watcher alfiecole has pretty much managed it with this .
he snapped this in irthlingborough this morning .
the good news is it 's meant to brighten up this afternoon .
it will feel a bit milder , too , in any sunshine .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: nominations close for inspirational woman award
text: thanks to everyone who nominated someone for the # inspirationalwomanaward the shortlist will be announced at the end of february !

documents.title: in and out at sixfields
text: it was n't the busiest of transfer deadline days for northampton town , but they still got some business done before the window closed .
portsmouth striker michael smith ( above ) has joined on loan for the rest of the season .
he 's scored six goals in 21 appearances this season and has previously had spells at charlton and swindon .
meanwhile , winger alfie potter ( above ) has left sixfields and joined mansfield town , joining former cobblers midfielder joel byrom in nottinghamshire .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: 'time to draw a line ' , northampton mp says
text: as mps prepare to vote on legislation that would give the government the go-ahead to trigger article 50 and begin the formal process of leaving the eu , the conservative mp for northampton south says it 's time to `` draw a line '' under the referendum arguments .
david mackintosh , who backed remain , said : `` this is not the time for further division , the days of remain or brexit are over .

`` it is clear that we are leaving the european union and it 's crucial in the months and years ahead we work together to get the best deal we can for this country , and to focus on an international global outlook . ''
the bill is expected to pass its first test despite opposition from the snp , the liberal democrats and some pro-remain labour mps .
next week , opposition parties will try to push through a series of amendments as the bill undergoes detailed scrutiny .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nice weather for ducks
text: today it 'll be cloudy and misty with outbreaks of rain and drizzle through the morning .
gradually it 'll turn drier and brighter from the west during the afternoon , although rain may linger near the east coast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome back to the live page for northamptonshire where we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , weather and travel until 18:00 .
a full regional weather forecast is coming up shortly .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cobblers sign pompey striker smith
text: cobblers sign pompey striker smith

you can follow any transfers to northampton town , on deadline day , via the bbc sport website .
any other breaking news will appear here through the evening and overnight .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : mild overnight and tomorrow
text: staying cloudy across the bbc east region overnight with outbreaks of rain spreading eastwards .
temperatures by the end of the night may be higher than those recorded today with lows of 5c ( 41f ) .
a cloudy , misty start to wednesday with some outbreaks of rain .
gradually clearing eastwards with western counties brightening up .
eastern counties may stay cloudy until after dark and it 'll be a much milder day with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hoard of sovereigns and silver bars sold
text: hoard of sovereigns and silver bars sold

documents.title: amateur dramatic society loses £ 500 in castle theate adminstration
text: the head of an amateur dramatic society in wellingborough says they are still feeling effects of the closure of the castle theatre .
the venue closed in june last year , but the council re-opened in on an interim basis while they searched for someone to take it over .
wellingborough co-operative amateur dramatic society lost £ 500 after the theatre went into administration and are relying on their latest play to keep them going .
jane cox from the society said their show dead guilty , which opens on thursday , is `` make or break '' .
the show is being put on at wellingborough museum because they say it is `` more affordable '' than the castle .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: bin man suspended after video
text: an update now on the bin man caught on camera using his phone while driving the truck - he 's been suspended .
operator fcc environmental said the driver would remain suspended while a `` full investigation '' took place .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: bone and umunna in trump pow-wow
text: chuka umunna and peter bone have had a right pow-wow on the bbc news channel about the trump state visit .

mr umunna , the labour mp for streatham , says it would be `` outrageous '' for the us president to be asked to address the houses of parliament , saying he had `` peddled hate , misogyny , racism and islamaphobia '' during the presidential campaign and appeared now to be governing in the same way .
but mr bone , the conservative mp for wellingborough , says the president is the duly elected leader of the uk 's oldest and strongest ally and must be allowed to come .
mr bone asks his counterpart what he was doing when the chinese president xi jinping visited the uk in 2014 - calling into question china 's human rights record .
`` are you really defending chinese human rights on this programme , '' he asks his labour counterpart .
mr umunna insists `` he was n't happy with the chinese state visit '' but , on balance , he would rather welcome the chinese leader than mr trump .
author: Norman Smith
Assistant political editor

documents.title: mobile phone bin lorry driver suspended
text: mobile phone bin lorry driver suspended

documents.title: king 's college to have the first collyweston slate
text: russell osborn , a consultant for king 's college , cambridge which will be the first to use the newly excavated slate , told me that they will start using the stone in june 2018 .
king 's have helped finance the mine , in collyweston , to ensure they were able to have access to the first supply .
mr osborn said that heritage buildings such as king 's college need heritage materials when repairs are made .
previously , they would use reclaimed slate from demolition projects but he explained `` that is finite so a new source was needed '' .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: first stone taken from collyweston slate mine
text: a mine is has produced its first slate after a 40-year wait , which its owner described as `` fantastic '' .
nigel smith , with a newly excavated piece of collyweston slate , told me that he was rather emotional and that it was a `` momentous day '' .

collyweston slate , named after the northamptonshire village in which it is produced , has been used on illustrious buildings for more than 600 years - and the first fruits of the new supply will be heading to cambridge .
mr smith said : `` you would n't believe what hard work has gone in to get to this point . ''
after mining , the slate will be used in historic buildings .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: zakuani to return to northampton this week after meeting dr congo president
text: cobblers defender gaby zakuani may feature on saturday at walsall after returning from the africa cup of nations , but boss justin edinburgh told me it `` might be too soon '' .
zakuani , 30 , was injured for democratic republic of congo 's quarter-final on sunday , which they lost 2-1 to ghana .
edinburgh said zakuani , who captains his national team , is `` meeting the president '' of dr congo tomorrow and will be back in northampton on thursday and the club will assess his fitness then .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: your comments : bin lorry driver on the phone
text: on facebook you 've been commenting on the speedy bin man driving on the phone .
luke eggleston said : `` i 've got no time for people like this !
i hope he gets then sack and loses his driving licence , he could of killed someone . ''
sue sprason said : `` i agree it does n't look safe but it 's very mean that his work ( so called ) mate has filmed him .
could n't he have just told the driver ?
very wrong on both counts . ''
author: Facebook

text: it 'll be a cloudy , grey and murky afternoon , with outbreaks of light rain and drizzle for many .
in addition low cloud will shroud the hills , creating widespread hill fog over high ground .
top temperature today of 7c ( 45f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .

documents.title: investigation into bin man caught on camera
text: the waste truck was being driven through the leicestershire countryside towards market harborough , with the driver admitting he was `` daydreaming '' .
fcc environmental , which operates the service , said a `` full investigation '' was under way .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: bin lorry driver filmed on mobile phone
text: a bin man has been filmed using his mobile phone while driving down country lanes in leicestershire at speed
this footage was captured by a colleague who said he had raised the problem with employers without result .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: cobblers aiming to sign a striker and defender on deadline day
text: northampton town manager justin edinburgh says he is hoping to sign a defender and striker before the transfer window closes at 23:00 today , telling me that he `` hopes to have two players , at least , in the building today '' .

so far the cobblers have brought in forward luke williams from scunthorpe , and keshi anderson from crystal palace , both on loan , and defender neal eardley from hibernian for free , while midfielder lawson d'ath has left for luton .
edinburgh , who look over a fortnight ago , said they are `` working hard to make [ transfers ] happen '' and revealed they had missed out on some of their targets so far .
however , he believed that january is `` not the best window to do business '' .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: trains : disruption between milton keynes and watford
text: a broken down train between milton keynes central and watford junction is causing disruption to journeys between the two stations .
trains may be cancelled or delayed by up to 20 minutes .
southern services will not run between milton keynes central and watford junction .
disruption is expected until 12:00 .
# tring - disruption between milton keynes central and watford junction expected until 12:00
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: abbey restoration nears completion
text: abbey restoration nears completion

documents.title: worry over 40 mile round-trip for patients if hospital is cut
text: returning to the public meeting in brackley last night

chris cartmel , a town councillor , told me he worries that if services at the horton hospital in banbury are reduced or it gets closed then residents of south northamptonshire will have to travel `` over 20 miles away '' for medical treatments .

dr phillip stevens , a gp in brackley said he accepted some acute services , such as stroke care , should be at the john ratcliffe hospital in oxford or northampton general hospital , but the horton should `` provide a basic range of safe services which are accessible to our patients , which historically they have done '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: owners of nene park to meet with mp and others over demolition
text: the connservative mp for corby and east northamptonshire , tom pursglove , has revealed that the demolition of nene park has been temporarily halted while a meeting between himself , the site 's owner and other interested parties is arranged .
bulldozers were due to move in on the former home of rushden & diamonds in irthlingborough this month after the owners said it was a fire hazard .
mr pursglove has raised the issue of the stadium , which has been empty since 2012 , in the commons and also wrote to east northamptonshire council .

in the reply from the authority , the chief executive , david oliver , said he had spoken to the owner of nene park , keith cousins , and he had agreed to a meeting and the work on the site would be halted until then .
mr oliver also says the council is working with afc rushden & diamonds to find a permanent home for the club for next season .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingnene park demolition halted
text: the demolition of the former home of rushden and diamonds , nene park in irthlingborough has been halted pending a meeting with the site 's owner and `` interested parties '' .
more to follow .

documents.title: care home fees `` significantly increasing ''
text: northamptonshire county council says it is `` significantly increasing '' the fees it pays to care homes .

it comes in response to the northamptonshire association of registered care homes statistic that two-thirds of care home owners are unhappy at low fee rates and a lack of consultation - and they 're not signing new agreements .
but conservative councillor bill parker , who is responsible for adult social care , said `` we are significantly increasing the amount of money we pay to care homes '' .
the county council has re-opened the tendering process to allow more providers to sign up to take residents funded by the authority .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: care homes refuse to work with county council
text: two thirds of care homes in northamptonshire have refused to sign a new agreement to work with the county council , according to a care home organisation .
the northamptonshire association of registered care homes ( norarch ) says business owners are unhappy at low fee rates and a lack of consultation .
norarch spokesman glenn hurd ( said `` unfortunately this will mean more bed-blocking '' in local hospitals .
northamptonshire county council says it is re-opening the tendering process to allow more providers to sign up to agree to take residents funded by the authority .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: girl has 'one in a million ' disorder
text: girl has 'one in a million ' disorder

documents.title: hospital changes 'ensure patient safety '
text: health bosses say changes to a hospital that serves south northamptonshire will `` ensure patient safety and the best care from staff '' .
more than 50 people attended a public meeting in brackley last night about plans to see stroke services and some critical care at the horton general hospital in banbury move to oxford .
campaigners are angry about the plans .
but the oxfordshire clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) said : `` the changes being proposed are to ensure patient safety and the best care from staff with the right skills , all day every day . ''
a consultation is under way and the ccg says it will hold a public meeting in brackley on 27 february to hear the views of local people .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: anger in brackley at plans for hospital cuts
text: more than 50 people have attended a public meeting in brackley about plans to cut some services at a local hospital .
the meeting was organised by people opposed to changes at the horton general hospital in banbury , which serves part of south northamptonshire .
the plans could see stroke services and some critical care patients from the horton move to the john radcliffe in oxford .
but the banbury hospital could see investment in other areas .
campaigners say the changes will leave long journeys to oxford or northampton for patients and could be followed by more services being removed .
but the oxfordshire clinincal commissioning group says the changes will ensure patient safety .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: delays through milton keynes on london midland
text: a broken down train is causing delays on london midland this morning
due to a broken down freight train between milton keynes central and watford junction service running between these stations may be delayed

documents.title: stags to make three more signings
text: meanwhile at mansfield , manager steve evans is hoping to add three more to the six he 's already signed this window .
northampton 's alfie potter and oxford 's alex macdonald are among the names linked with the club .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Radio Nottingham sports reporter

documents.title: weather : misty and dull with outbreaks of rain
text: it will be and overcast and dull day across the bbc east region with outbreaks of rain and drizzle , which may turn heavier at times .
it will feel fairly chilly under the thick cloud with a high of 6c ( 43f ) .
here is my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire .
today we 'll be looking at care homes in the county and hospital cuts which could affect people in south northamptonshire .
plus today is transfer deadline day , so will northampton town manager justin edinburgh be bringing in any new players ?
if he does you 'll find out here later .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's it from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished - thanks for joining us .
scroll below to see anything you 've missed - and you can read more on weetabix and tata steel on the bbc news website .
we 'll see you again tomorrow from 08:00 - hope you 'll join us once more .

documents.title: delays and budget increases , but the restorations shows dramatic changes
text: there may have been delays and budget increases , but the work at delapre abbey is fascinating .
as you can see from these the change is quite dramatic .
this is what it looked like when i visited two years ago
and this is what it looks like now
two years ago
now
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: spending on delapre abbey set to increase
text: more than half a million pounds of further funding is needed to complete the restoration of delepre abbey in northampton .
it 's in addition to the extra £ 930,000 the borough council gave the project last year .
it brings the total cost close to £ 8m .
the borough council 's cabinet has been asked to agree to the extra funding , which could be up to £ 650,000 after unexpected delays to the project .
the abbey 's opening has been put back several times , but once open it 's hoped it will become a major tourist attraction .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: duckett 'could n't be happier ' as team-mate white gets lions call-up
text: northamptonshire opener ben duckett has tweeted his congratulations to team-mate graeme white , after the spinner was selected for england lions ' one-day series against sri lanka a .
james whitaker , england cricket 's national selector , said white `` deserves this chance '' after his performances for northants .
duckett , 22 , who is already in the squad , says he `` ca n't wait '' to join-up with the 29 year old
could n't be happier for graeme ! !
fully deserved and ca n't wait to be playing with ya # hellloooo

documents.title: local paper round-up : sleep-out raises thousands , wellingborough council tax increase
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how to see inside a weetabix box without opening it
text: i 've come the weetabix factory at burton latimer after the company announced a £ 30m investment .
did you know every cereal pack has an x-ray ?
every pack x-rayed @ twitterid
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: union says weetabix workers due to vote on 'improved ' offer over shift work
text: earlier we mentioned weetabix 's chief executive said the threat of strike action from workers had `` gone away '' for the time being .
the row was over a change to a new 24-hour , seven days a week shift pattern .
union usdaw has since told us the revised offer from the company would go out to ballot between 1 and 10 february .
members voted for industrial action in december , but put that `` on hold '' after discussions with the company .
usdaw said it put weetabix 's `` improved '' offer to members after `` positive engagement '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and cloudy this afternoon
text: generally cloudy and dry conditions will persist through this afternoon for many , although some brighter spells are likely at times too , with highs of 7c ( 45f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: tata steel pension offer : an analysis
text: it is a big and very difficult decision to make .
those workers who are union members will choose whether they want to remain on the final salary scheme or accept the less generous one being offered by tata .
the new pension comes with the promise of £ 1bn of funding for port talbot over the next 10 years , but only if the company is hitting profit targets .
but even with the offer of a pensions top-up for older workers , it will mean significantly less money for their retirement .
some people said given the year they have gone through with the job losses , the sale and then its cancellation , they have simply lost trust in tata .
this ballot is about the unions consulting their members .
its result will dictate how officials deal with the company , but the outcome is not binding on tata itself .
author: Brian Meechan
BBC Wales business correspondent

documents.title: pension offer 'best outcome ' , say steel unions
text: community , gmb and unite union members are involved in the vote over the revised pension offer , after a year which has seen major job losses and tata 's business being put up for sale .
however , the company took it off the market as economic conditions in the industry improved .

under the proposed changes , the british steel pension scheme would close to future accrual , replaced with a defined contribution scheme with maximum contributions of 10 % from tata and 6 % from workers .
the unions originally stood back from making any official recommendations , saying it was down to individual circumstances .
but after a meeting of 100 officials from plants across the uk on thursday , they issued a joint statement saying the offer was the `` best outcome that could be achieved through negotiation '' .
it also emerged a one-off pension contribution of up to £ 10,000 could be made to tata workers in their 50s who plan to retire early .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: tata steel : union ballot to start on pensions offer
text: a ballot on a new pensions offer is expected to be put to tata steel workers from today .
the three unions at the indian company 's uk plants are recommending their members , including 578 tata workers in corby , accept the deal .
they have called it the `` only credible and viable way '' to secure the future .
although a less generous pension scheme , the tata offer also includes a £ 1bn investment commitment at port talbot and no compulsory job losses .
the result of the ballot is expected by the middle of february .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: female pedestrian dies after being hit by car in barby
text: a woman has died after being hit by a car in barby , near daventry .
the crash happened at about 11.30 on friday , at the junction of kilsby road and nortoft lane .
police say a grey vauxhall insignia , driven by a 54-year-old man from rugby , hit 32-year-old anna hodgkins , from barby , who died hours later in hospital .
northamptonshire police is appealing for witnesses .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spinner white called up to england lions squad
text: northamptonshire 's graeme white has been called up by the england lions - the national side 's second string .
the left-arm spinner will play for the lions in their one-day series in sri lanka in march .
white was named player of the year in the domestic one-day cup competition last summer and was a vital part of northants ' victorious t20 team .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: flares set off in town centre pub before northampton v coventry match
text: following reports of disruption at sixfields on saturday , we 've heard police were also called to o'neills pub in the drapery in northampton half an hour before kick-off due to three flares being set off inside .
the pub was evacuated as a precaution .
police say nobody was believed to have been hurt and nobody was detained in connection with the incident .
o'neill 's said the pub closed until about 16:00 to allow smoke to clear and it then `` traded as normal for the rest of the day '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weetabix 'believes ' row over shift pattern resolved
text: giles turrell , the chief executive of weetabix , says threatened strike action `` for the time being that has gone away '' .
last month workers at the factories in burton latimer and corby voted to strike over shift patterns .
however , earlier this month union usdaw said the action was `` on hold '' after the company made a new offer aimed at resolving the row .
asked about the whether the issue was resolved , mr turrell answered `` we believe so '' .
we 've contacted usdaw for comment .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: who wants weetabix ?
text: all this talk of weetabix and no news on whether the company is being sold ?
current owner , the chinese company bright food , bought the british breakfast staple provider in 2012 and has made sure the oval wheat bricks are reaching more breakfast tables in china .
but reports are circulating that it 's talking to potential buyers .
weetabix 's chief executive , giles turrell , was more than happy to talk about who is eating weetabix , how healthy their products are ( or not ) and potential price rises .
but ( not surprisingly ) he would n't be drawn on any possible sale .
still , others reckon that associated british foods , the us 's post holdings and italy 's barilla could be interested .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: weetabix warns of price rises this year
text: despite the announcement of investment , weetabix has become the latest company to warn of price rises sparked by the lower pound .

although the company takes its wheat from within 50 miles of its processing plants in burton latimer and corby , wheat is priced in dollars and the weaker pound means it takes more pounds to buy dollar-listed items .
giles turrell , the chief executive of weetabix , told the bbc rises would be a last resort and would be in the low single digits .
a range of companies , including next and easyjet , have warned of higher prices following the fall in sterling , triggered by june 's vote to leave the european union .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: multimillion-pound investment in weetabix factories
text: weetabix has announced plans for major new investment in its factories at burton latimer and corby .
the company says it 's set to spend £ 30m , which should lead to increased production of its range of breakfast products and could create more jobs .
giles turrell , weetabix 's chief executive , has been giving his reaction to the bbc this morning
it 's good news for the company , it 's good news for our farmers , and it 's good news for the local area . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police defend criticism over disrupted northampton v coventry match
text: there 's been much criticism of the police response to the disruptions in saturday 's northampton v coventry clash at sixfields , with fans airing their views on the northampton chronicle and echo 's facebook page .

one fan wrote the police `` failed dismally to stop coventry fans continually disrupting the match and instead employ the majority of their manpower on guarding the west stand where there was no sign of trouble '' .

however , supt chris hillery from northamptonshire police said : `` acknowledging we were never going to stop 1,000 fans entering the pitch , our tactics were to form a police line in front of the home fans to stop the away fans entering the home area . ''
he added : `` during the fixture we were made aware that some of the spectators in the away south stand had planned a mass pitch incursion at a designated time .

`` as a result , match officials turned off the scoreboard time display and officers were placed in front of the west stand and in the players ' tunnel to prevent people intent on disorder entering these areas en masse . ''
mr hillery went on to thank the cobblers ' supporters for their behaviour .
nine men have been arrested and bailed over the disruption , believed to have been a protest at coventry city 's owners .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pitch invasion 'unacceptable ' says club
text: the repeated disruptions to yesterday 's sky blues match at northampton town were `` unacceptable , '' a coventry city spokesman says .
nine men have been arrested and bailed over a pitch invasion and flares being thrown at the match at sixfields .
in a statement on the club 's website , the club says it will support both the police and fa investigations .
the repeated disruptions to yesterday 's match at northampton town were unacceptable .
the club recognises that the inexcusable conduct was led by a small number of people .
the club does not and will not condone any such behaviour .
coventry city fc will support all subsequent investigations by the police and football authorities . ''

documents.title: david brickwood murder : police find 'a number of items ' during lake search
text: police say divers who spent four days searching eastfield park lake in northampton as part of the david brickwood murder investigation have recovered `` a number of items '' .
mr brickwood was stabbed in his own home in the abington area of the town in september 2015 .
det insp phil mills , from the investigation team , says it 's too early to say whether the items are related to the case , but they will now undergo a forensic examination .
police have not specified what sort of items were found or how many .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: sky blues protests mar northampton v coventry clash
text: nine men have been arrested over a pitch invasion and flares being thrown at sixfields on saturday .
the cobblers ' 3-0 win over coventry city was disrupted several times
northamptonshire police said six arrests were made when spectators from the away stand invaded the pitch and a further three when flares were let-off .
match reports said the fans were protesting against the coventry club 's owners .
coventry city called the disruption `` unacceptable '' .
the arrested men have been bailed .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a cloudy and mild day
text: it 's a grey start to the week , with a lot of cloud around the bbc east region .
feeling rather damp , with the odd spot of drizzle and mist .
a mild day , with maximum temperatures between 6-8c ( 42-46f ) .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to live updates for northamptonshire .
this morning we 'll be bringing you more on what happened over the weekend at sixfields , with a pitch invasion and flares being thrown by coventry fans .
plus news of tata steel and weetabix .
but first up , today 's weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
